message_1: A company has 5 projects to complete, and each project requires a team of a different size. The project manager wants to assign each employee to at least one project, while minimizing the total number of required employees. The required team sizes for each project are: project 1: 3 employees, project 2: 5 employees, project 3: 2 employees, project 4: 4 employees, project 5: 2 employees. What is the minimum number of employees needed to complete all of the projects?
message_2:
To minimize the total number of employees needed, the project manager should assign employees to the projects in such a way that each employee is assigned to only one project. In this case, the minimum number of employees needed is the sum of the required team sizes for each project.

Minimum number of employees = 3 (project 1) + 5 (project 2) + 2 (project 3) + 4 (project 4) + 2 (project 5) = 16 employees.
